Clemons Library offers reservable rooms for using media and technology in support of teaching, learning and research. These classrooms can only be reserved for occasional classes and must be scheduled in accordance with the University class schedule for that day.

Reserve a Media Classroom
      Features
Room 322 Seats 20
  • Reservable by faculty and teaching graduate students only
  • Media viewing technology for Blu-ray, Blu-Ray 3D, multi-region DVD, VHS, and LaserDisc formats
  • Large viewing screen
  • Windows PC with Unified build
  • Document camera
  • VGA and HDMI laptop connections
  • Whiteboards
  Room 407 Seats 24
  • Reservable by faculty and teaching graduate students only
  • Media viewing technology for Blu-ray, multi-region DVD, VHS, and LaserDisc formats
  • Large viewing screen
  • Windows PC with Unified build
  • VGA and HDMI laptop connections
  • Apple TV for wireless streaming of MacOS and iOS devices
  • Whiteboards
  G-Lab Seats 20
  • Students may reserve the G-Lab for media classes. Students wishing to reserve the G-Lab should email libraryinstruction@virginia.edu with their request. Faculty and teaching graduate students can reserve the G-Lab using the "Reserve a Media Classroom" link above.
  • This class room is designed for media instruction (software instruction and post production).
  • 20 iMac workstations â€“ with 5K displays, microphone and headphones
  • Projector with dropdown screen
  • 2 side monitors
  • All computers have media software preinstalled such as Adobe CC 2017, Final Cut Pro X, iMovie, Logic Pro X, Maya 2017, Unity, and much more, see full software list.
